means: 正餐，主餐( dinner的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Overcooked greens are my most vivid recollection of school dinners.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我对学校午餐的回忆中，印象最深刻的就是蔬菜总是炒过头。

sentence.Network_en: Some drinks prepare appetite for dinners.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些饮料可使人在饭前开胃.

sentence.Network_en: After all, it is no use serving up TV dinners if the kids won't eat them.
sentence.Network_cn: 毕竟，如果孩子不想吃冷冻快餐，给他们也没用。

PerfectNetExp.abs: For most informal dinners , you should wear comfortable and casual clothes ., 大多数非正式的聚餐 , 你应该穿舒适 , 休闲的衣服.

a school in Yokohama near Tokyo has decided to cancel school dinners for two days in January on account of the recent spike in oil prices , media reports and an official said .据媒体报道及一名官员介绍，由于近期油价飙升，位于东京附近横滨市的一所学校决定明年一月份取消两天的伙食供应。
The coolerator was crammed with TV dinners and ginger ale ., 他们的冰箱里就塞满了电视便餐与姜味啤酒.

entry.def: Dinner is the main meal of the day, usually served in the early part of the evening.

example.ex: She invited us to her house for dinner...
example.tran: 她请我们去她家吃晚餐。

example.ex: Would you like to stay and have dinner?...
example.tran: 你留下来一起吃饭好吗？

entry.def: Any meal you eat in the middle of the day can be referred to as dinner .
A dinner is a formal social event at which a meal is served. It is held in the evening.

example.ex: ...a series of official lunches and dinners...
example.tran: 一系列的正式午餐和晚宴

example.ex: The Professional Cricketers' Association held its annual dinner in London.
example.tran: 职业板球运动员协会在伦敦举办了自己的年度宴会。

Sentence.sentence: French fries, washed down with a pint of soda, are a favorite part of fast-food lunches and dinners for millions of American youngsters.
Nor do I go to cocktail parties, dinners or anything like that.
